column3: bump on an easy dedupe merge

@theuni ping Seems this stuff could generally use a cleanup (merge SetSocketNonBlocking/SetSocketNoDelay, also do we need to set SO_NOSIGPIPE on the newly-listened socket (looks like it inherits), maybe would be nice to merge that too?\n\nAnyway, utACK ad415bc16afdb4fdb6d619624762f1324751a824 this itself, its still a strict improvement.

utACK ad415bc16afdb4fdb6d619624762f1324751a824.\n\n@TheBlueMatt We're about to get new socket creation handling from libevent (I'm working on it now), so I'm not too worried about further refactors here.
I don't like this ;-) #ifdef in the middle of the function is worst in my eyes than the previuos solution.

You mean in the middle of the function call?  I agree it looks visually worse, but I like deduplicating code as much as possible.\n\nHowever on longer consideration, I realized that the conversion from (const char*) to (const void*) will happen implicitly on any platform, so this ifdef isn't even needed.
Indeed, seems like the WIN32 check was unnecessary, every pointer can be passed to a `void*` parameter including `char*` so the redundant cast doesn't matter.

I'd feel slightly better with `rc == 0`. 0 is guaranteed to be the success value both in Windows and UNIX, whereas on failure [windows returns](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms740476(v=vs.85).aspx) `SOCKET_ERROR` (which may or may not be -1, it's not mentioned).
But of course, I usually idiomatically check rc == 0 from system calls.  Not sure why I went with != -1.
